questions.text: Symmetrical intrauterine growth restriction is due to
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Causes of symmetrical intrauterine growth restriction is:
•    Intrauterine infection 
•    Chromosomal disorder 
•    Metabolic disorder – Insulin deficiency 
•    Teratogens

questions.text: All are the respiratory problems usually seen in preterm child except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Transient tachypnea of newborn is most common cause of respiratory distress in term child. On chest X-ray there is prominent on bulging fissure seen.

choices.text: Admit the baby and start antibiotic
Send CBC, CRP, blood culture, blood glucose and serum calcium
Keep baby under observation and monitor the child
Maintain temperature and increase frequency of breast feeds

questions.text: A 24 hours old male infant born term is found to be lethargic. There is history of rupture of membranes 18 hours before delivery. The baby has fever of 1010F and is feeding well. Following should be done in this child
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Child is having fever and lethargic which is suggestive of neonatal sepsis. Also there is history of rupture of membranes 18 hours before delivery which is a risk factor of neonatal sepsis.

choices.text: Maternal history of previously affected infants

questions.text: Risk of development of respiratory distress syndrome increases in all of the following except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Antenatal steroids decreases the risk of hyaline membrane disease, intraventricular hemorrhage and necrotizing entercolitis.

questions.text: Chest compressions are given in neonate in:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Chest compression are applied over lower one third of sternum.

Ratio of chest compression: positive pressure ventilation is 3: 1 given every 2 seconds

questions.text: Therapeutic hypothermia is used in management of:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Therapeutic hypothermia or cooling of head is done in hypoxic ischemia encephalopathy to decrease ischemic reperfusion injury

questions.text: In small for gestational age the infant’s weight is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

In SGA birth weight < 10th percentile. 
It is diagnosed at birth
Can be pathological or physiological (constitutional)

questions.text: First line antiepileptic drug for neonatal seizures is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

First investigation to be done is serum glucose level 
First antiepileptic drug is phenobarbitone.
If seizure inspite of phenobarbitone, we add phenytoin.

questions.text: Physiological jaundice in a term child can present upto:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Physiological jaundice is not seen on day 1 of life. 
It can persist upto day 14 in term child and day 21 in preterm child.

choices.text: Due to increased β-glucuronidase in breast milk
Usually seen in first week of life

questions.text: All are true about breast milk jaundice except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Breast milk jaundice is usually diagnosed in second or third week of life in child on exclusive breast feeds since birth.

questions.text: Late onset neonatal sepsis is defined as the onset of symptoms after:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Late onset sepsis is onset after 72 hours of birth. 
It is community or hospital acquired. Presents as neonatal meningitis.

questions.text: For prediction of neonatal sepsis ratio of immature to total neutrophil count is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

In neonatal sepsis there is neutropenia. To compensate there is movement of immature neutrophil from bone marrow to blood. 
So immature: total neutrophil ratio ≥ 0.2

questions.text: 34 weeks infant, weight is 1.7kg. Kangaroo mother care is initiated in this child. Hallmark of Kangaroo mother care is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Hallmark of kangaroo mother care is skin to skin contact. Child is usually kept in frog like position on chest.

choices.text: Specific light wavelength at specific narrow peak – 460 nm
At least 80% of body surface area should be exposed

questions.text: Criteria for effective phototherapy in newborn is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

-    Bilirubin specifically absorbs the light in the wavelength 450 – 460 nm.
-    Skin hyperpigmentation does not affect the efficiency of phototherapy.

questions.text: Infant is most likely to have neonatal varicella if mother gets chickenpox:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Risk of neonatal varicella is there if mother gets varicella 5 days before delivery to 2 days after birth. Drug given is Acyclovir.

questions.text: In herpes simplex virus II causing skin, eye and mucus membrane lesions in neonate, drug given is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

In herpes simplex virus acyclovir is given. 
•    Skin, eye and mucous membrane – 14 days 
•    Encephalitis – 21 days

questions.text: Child is born with microcephaly and morphological features as shown. Following is advisable in this child except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Microcephaly and contractures at birth are suggestive of congenital zika syndrome. 
In cytomegalo virus there is risk of pneumonia, not in zika virus.

questions.text: 15 month old child can do the following:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

2 year – walks upstairs and downstairs 2 feet per step/ 1 step at a time. 
3 year – upstairs 1 foot per step, downstairs 2 feet per step
4 year – downstairs 1 foot per step

questions.text: Child skips, draws triangle from copy and repeat sentence of 10 syllables. Age of the child is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

•    Hops – 4 years 
•    Skips – 5 years 
•    Draw a circle – 3 years 
•    Draw a cross – 4 years 
•    Draw a triangle – 5 years

choices.text: Walks on hands and feet like a bear

questions.text: 1 year child can do all the following except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Jargons comes at the age of 15 months. 
11 months – child walks with both hands held. 
12 month – child walks with one hand held.

questions.text: 2 years old child can do all of the following except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

2½ year – child can identify 1 colour
5 year – child can identify 4 colour 
2 year – listens to stories 
4 year – tell a story

questions.text: 6 year old child has intelligence quotient of 50%. Which of the following milestone will be present in the child:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Milestones depend upon mental age 
Mental age = Chronological age x intelligence quotient 
So here = 6 x 50 / 100 = 3 years
So the child will ride a tricycle.

questions.text: Child demands things by saying ‘give me’. He can build a tower seven blocks, can run and climbs the stairs. Developmental age of the child is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Runs – 18 months 
Climb stairs – 24 months 
Builds tower of 3 cubes – 15 months
Builds tower of 4 cubes – 18 months
Builds tower of 7 cubes – 24 months
Builds tower of 10 cubes – 36 months

questions.text: A child is half of adult height at the age of:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Half of adult height is achieved at the age of 2 years / 18 – 24 months 
Height is taken above the age of 2 years and below 2 yeas length is taken.

choices.text: Onset of secondary sexual development is delayed

questions.text: All are true about constitutional delay in growth and puberty except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Most common cause of short stature is constitutional.
Birth length is normal 
Puberty is delayed 
Final / ultimate height – normal

choices.text: Constitutional delay in growth and puberty

questions.text: Child was short at birth but achieved normal mid parental height. Most likely due to:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

In familial short stature birth length is decreased. 
Rate of growth in childhood is decreased.
Child is short according to population but normal for midparental height.

questions.text: A 10 month old male infant has been brought to OPD because he is not growing fast enough. On examination he is 2nd percentile for weight and 5th percentile for height. At this age greatest influence on her growth rate is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Maximum growth is affected by nutrition in infancy.
In childhood it is affected by growth hormone and thyroxine.

questions.text: Child with weight for age <60% of expected and presence of edema is classified as:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

choices.text: 3 Doses of 2 lakh IU on 1,2,14 days

questions.text: Dose of Vitamin A, in a child 15 months, weighing 7 kgs and diagnosed as severe acute malnutrition is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

In SAM, additional doses of vitamin A are given.
6 months – 1 year – 1 lakh IU 
> 1 year – 2 lakh IU
> 1 year < 8 kgs – 1 lakh IU
Sign of vitamin A deficiency or history of recent measles – 3 doses on 1,2,14 days.

questions.text: Child is diagnosed as a case of rickets. Cholecalciferol was given twice but no improvement is seen. On examination PTH is increased, serum phosphorous is increased and serum calcium is normal. Most likely cause of rickets is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Child not responding to cholecalciferol is resistant rickets. Here PTH and serum phosphorous both are increased which is suggestive of chronic renal failure.

questions.text: Out of the following reliable sign of dehydration in severely malnourished child is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Non reliable sign of dehydration in malnourished child is 
•    Skin turgor 
•    Mental state 
•    Tongue and buccal mucosa 
Most reliable sign of dehydration is urine output.

questions.text: Good weight gain in malnourished child is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

In malnourished child
Good weight gain > 10 gm/kg/day
Moderate weight gain 5 – 10 gm/kg/day
Poor weight gain < 5 gm/kg/day

questions.text: 5 years old child comes with compliant of valgus deformity of the legs and increased alkaline phosphatase. Which of the following will be useful in diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Features given are suggestive of rickets. So x-ray wrist joint should be done to confirm the diagnosis.

questions.text: 3 year old child has swollen gums, petechiae and cries on being handled. Out of the following which is most useful for diagnosis:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Vitamin C is not stored in the body. So serum levels are not reliable as there is diurnal variation. So it is measured in WBC.

questions.text: Which of the following milestone is relatively spared in child of Downs syndrome:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Social development is relatively spared in child of Down syndrome

questions.text: Following is decreased in Down’s syndrome:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

alpha protein – decreased 
Screening test in 1st trimester – Nuchal translucency thickness 
Screening test in 2nd trimester
Quad screening – βHCG – increased 
 Inhibin – increased 
 α fetoprotein – decreased 
 Unconjugated estriol – decreased

questions.text: Child 5 years old, is obese and has tendency to eat more. On examination there is small hands and feet and IQ is less. It is due to involvement of the following chromosome region:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Features are suggestive of Pradar Willi syndrome
It follows non mendelian inheritance and there is involvement of 15q11 - 13

questions.text: Male has anti-mongoloid slant, pulmonary stenosis and mental retardation. Most likely it is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

In Noonan syndrome is – due to sporadic mutation. 
•    Both males and females are affected 
•    Most common congenital heart disease – pulmonic stenosis 
•    Downward slant of palpebral fissure is present 
•    Presence of mental retardation

questions.text: Female child was brought for evaluation for dysmorphic features. All of the following cardiac malformation can be seen in this child except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Mitral stenosis 
Feature given are suggestive of Turner’s syndrome
Most common congenital heart disease is bicuspid aortic valve disease
In Turner’s syndrome mainly left side of heart is affected

choices.text: Thyroid function test and peripheral blood film
Thyroid function test and anti-tissue transglutaminase
Peripheral blood film and anti-tissue transglutaminase
Serum lipid profile and thyroid function test

questions.text: A 5-year-old child with Down syndrome has come for follow-up. Blood tests you would like to do on follow up is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

In child there is risk of hypothyroidism and leukemia. So thyroid function test and peripheral blood film are to be done every year. 
Also every year – Hemoglobin, hearing test and vision to be checked

questions.text: Full term male was born to a 33 years old primigravida mother. There is presence of dysmorphic features including prominent occiput, head circumference 29cm and clenched fist with overlapping of digits. Most likely chromosomal configuration of this neonate is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Edwards syndrome 
Feature given are suggestive of Edwards syndrome. In this Karyotyping is 47XY, +18.
Features present are clenched fist with overlapping of digits

questions.text: Most common tumour with bony metastasis in children is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Neuroblastoma 
•    Most common malignant tumour in infancy.
•    Most common malignant tumour in infancy associated with spontaneous regression.
•    Most common abdominal tumour in children 
•    Most common tumour in children with bony metastases.

questions.text: Wilms tumour is associated with all of the following except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Syndrome associated with Wilm’s tumour include 
A.    WAGR syndrome – Aniridia 
B.   Denys Drash syndrome – Male pseudo hermaphroditism 
C.   Beckwith Wiedemann syndrome – hemi hypertrophy

questions.text: 8 years old child presents with gait disturbances, Nystagmus and features of increased intracranial pressure. This can be due to the following brain tumour:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Medulloblastoma 

Child is having feature of increased ICP and cerebellar signs present. Medulloblastoma is the most common malignant tumour of brain in children and it arises from cerebellum

questions.text: 18 months old girl presents with coryza, cough and mild fever for 3 days. Respiratory rate is normal and there is no chest recession. Most likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

upper respiratory tract infection 
As respiratory rate is normal and there is no chest recession it rules out pneumonia. 
In frontal sinusitis there should be headache present. 
In bronchiolitis, wheezing is present.

questions.text: In primary ciliary dyskinesia there is mutation in protein:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Mutation in protein dynein is seen 
There is situs inversus, bronchiectasis and infertility in both male and female

choices.text: Heel prick for immune reactive trypsinogen

questions.text: 5 months old infant has history of difficulty in breathing and poor feeding. On examination respiratory rate of 60 breaths/min and bilateral crepts are present. His weight is now below the 40th percentile. There is history of neonatal jaundice. Most appropriate investigation to be done is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Sweat chloride test 
Features are suggestive of cystic fibrosis. The respiratory rate is increased and there is bilateral crepts. In 5 months old child first investigation is to be done is sweat chloride test.

questions.text: Fast breathing is a child aged 6 months is respiratory rate more than:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Fast breathing 
•    < 2 months - > 60/min
•    2 - 12 months - > 50/min
•    12 - 59 months - > 40/min

choices.text: Short acting beta agonist and inhaled corticosteroids

questions.text: Child is begin diagnosed as having intermittent asthma. Out of the following treatment to be given is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

In intermittent asthma we should give short acting beta agonist and inhaled corticosteroids for short duration. 
Daily inhaled corticosteroids or leukotriene modifiers are given in mild persistent asthma

questions.text: In which of the following congenital heart disease, prophylaxis for infective endocarditis is not required:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

ASD
In ASD there is no endocardial damage, so prophylaxis for infective endocarditis is not required.

questions.text: Out of the following not seen in congestive cardiac failure in newborn is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Pedal Edema
Reliable sign of congestive heart failure in infancy is hepatomegaly. 
In ventricular septal defect it is seen between 6 – 8 weeks after birth.

questions.text: Obstructive type of total anomalous pulmonary venous connection is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Infracardiac
Due to closure of ductus venosus, pulmonary vein blood does not react the heart. So it is called obstructive type of TAPVC.

questions.text: In all of the following are ductus dependent systemic circulation seen except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Ebstein’s anomaly 
In ebstein’s anomaly, pulmonary circulation is ductal dependent. In all other choices systemic circulation is ductal dependent

questions.text: Cyanotic congenital heart disease with left atrial and left ventricular enlargement is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Tricuspid atresia 
Blood goes from RA to LA through ASD, then LV and then to RV through VSD. So left ventricle maintains both pulmonary and systemic circulation causing left ventricular hypertrophy.
Cyanosis + LVH = Tricuspid atresia.

questions.text: Major criteria in the diagnosis of rheumatic fever is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Erythema marginatum
Major criteria in Rheumatic fever include 
a.    Carditis 
b.    Arthritis 
c.    Subcutaneous nodules 
d.    Sydenham’s chorea 
e.    Erythema margination

questions.text: Pulmonary to systemic blood flow ratio (Qp : Qs) consistent with tetralogy of fallot is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

0.7 : 1
In Tetralogy of fallot, pulmonary blood flow is decreased, so QP < QS.

questions.text: Best intravenous fluid for treatment of dehydration due to diarrhea is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Ringer lactate
In severe dehydration, intravenous fluid is given.
In diarrhea – Ringer lactate > Normal saline.
In vomiting – Normal saline is preferred.

questions.text: All are the sign of severe dehydration in an infant except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Irritability
Sign of some dehydration include 
-    Irritability / Restless 
-    Increased thirst 
-    Skin turgor – delayed recoil < 2 seconds
-    Decreased urine output

questions.text: Most common infection seen in nephrotic syndrome is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

In Nephrotic syndrome due to loss of factor “B” in urine, there is increased incidence of infection. Most common causative organism is streptococcus pneumoniae > E. Coli
It can causes spontaneous bacterial peritonitis.

questions.text: Following radiological investigation should be done in 6 year old child after first episode of urinary tract infection:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: 3 year old child was diagnosed as Nephrotic syndrome and started on prednisone. Steroid responsive nephrotic syndrome means that remission is seen within how many weeks of starting the steroid therapy
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Steroid responsive nephrotic syndrome is remission within 4 weeks of starting steroid treatment.
Remission is urinary protein: creatinine ratio of < 0.2 for 3 consecutive days.

questions.text: Henoch Schonlein purpura commonly involves age group:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

HSP is now called IgA vasculitis. It is usually seen after respiratory tract infection. Most common age group affected is 3 – 10 years of age.

questions.text: For screening of congenital hypothyroidism following is measured:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

T4 and TSH are measured between 2 – 5 days after birth

questions.text: 36 weeks preterm baby has history of excessive sucking of mother breast and crying for 20 hours. On examination there is increased HR, RR and temperature. Microcephaly is present. There is also history of fetal tachycardia present. All of the following investigations will be useful for diagnosis except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Features given are suggestive of hyperthyroidism 
So investigations required are 
-    Thyroid receptor stimulation antibody 
-    T4 and TSH level 
-    Bone age estimation 
-    Thyroid receptor blocking antibody are required in case of hypothyroidism

questions.text: All of the following features are suggestive of pan hypopituitarism in neonatal period except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Low birth weight 
In hypothyroidism there should be birth weight > 4 kgs
ACTH deficiency causes – hypoglycemia 
Birth length is normal, as growth hormone deficiency has no effect in intrauterine period.

questions.text: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia with hypertension is due to deficiency of enzyme:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

17α hydroxylase deficiency 
In congenital adrenal hyperplasia 
a.    Salt wasting crisis is seen in – 21 hydroxylase deficiency 
-    3βHSD deficiency 
b.    Hypertension is seen in – 17 hydroxylase deficiency 
-    11 hydroxylase deficiency

questions.text: All are the features of simple febrile seizures except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Simple febrile seizures usually lasts for less than 15 minutes. 
No EEG and neuroimaging is required. 
No prophylaxis is needed.

questions.text: Most common cause of communicating hydrocephalus in India is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Tubercular meningitis 
Most common cause of communicating hydrocephalus is 
India – tubercular meningitis 
World – Subarachnoid hemorrhage 
Most common cause overall – Cerebral aqueductal stenosis

questions.text: All chromosomal location is correctly matched except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Sturge weber syndrome 
Due to sporadic mutation (Non hereditary)
Von Hippel Lindau disease is due to involvement of chromosome 3

questions.text: 2 days female neonate delivered at home came with history of mass on the back. On examination a reddish leaking lesion is seen on the lumbar region. Lower limbs are hypotonic and areflexic. On MRI there is presence of hydrocephalus. Most likely cause is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Arnold chiari malformation – type II
Presence of leaking lesion on back is suggestive of meningomyelocele and there is presence of hydrocephalus 
In Dandy Walker there is triad of 
•    Posterior fossa cyst 
•    Enlarged 4th ventricle 
•    Abnormally formed cerebellum

questions.text: 8 year old girl has history of gradual loss of interest in studies, irritability and episodes of abnormal behavior. Starting about 6 months back. On examination child is afebrile, no pallor, jaundice or cutaneous bleed. No involvement of cranial nerve is seen. There is an involuntary movement in the form of myoclonic jerks of the trunk. Most likely cause is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Subacute sclerosing panencephalitis 
-    Complication of Mumps. There is presence of myoclonic jerks 
-    Absence seizure is also seen between 5 to 8 years of age but there are no myoclonic jerks

questions.text: 4 year old boy come with history of abnormal movements of all his limbs. When the child sleeps there is hypotonia. Following history will be relevant in diagnosis:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Features of suggestive of extrapyramidal involvement 
It can be seen in 
a)    Birth asphyxia in term child causing – Status Marmoratus 
b)    Rheumatic fever following streptococcal pharyngitis 
c)    Kernicterus

questions.text: In meningococcal meningitis antibiotics therapy is given for:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

5 – 7 days
Meningococcal meningitis – 3rd generation cephalosporin x 5 – 7 days 
Hemophilus influenzae B - 3rd generation cephalosporin x 7 – 10 days 
St. pneumoniae - 3rd generation cephalosporin x 10 – 14 days

questions.text: 5 year old boy presented with day dreaming and decline in school performance. Most likely cause is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Typical absence seizure 
Age of child given is 5 years and features are suggestive of absence seizure. Drug of choice is Ethosuximide.

questions.text: Hypsarrthymia pattern in EEG is seen in:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

West syndrome is also known as infantile spasms. There is a triad of 
-    Neurodevelopmental regression 
-    Spasms 
-    Hypsarrthymia EEG
